meanings.sent1: I can produce a drawing of a house.
meanings.sent2: The factory will produce many toys.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to produce a rabbit from his hat.
meanings.sent4: Her hard work will produce great results.
meanings.sent5: The chef can produce delicious meals in no time.

meanings.sent1: The apple tree will produce fruit in the summer.
meanings.sent2: The farm can produce a lot of corn.
meanings.sent3: The joke made him produce a loud laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her efforts will produce positive changes.
meanings.sent5: The sun can produce warmth on a cold day.

meanings.definition: Fruits and vegetables grown for food
meanings.sent1: The market sells fresh produce every day.
meanings.sent2: She bought organic produce from the store.
meanings.sent4: The farmer's market had a variety of produce.
meanings.sent5: Eating a lot of produce is good for your health.

meanings.sent1: The school play was a great produce.
meanings.sent2: The opera house will have a new produce next week.
meanings.sent3: The musical produce received a standing ovation.
meanings.sent4: The theater group put on an impressive produce.
meanings.sent5: Attending a live produce is always exciting.
